intro: Chamaeiris urumovii, commonly known as the Urumov's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found growing on cliffs and slopes, where it can withstand harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
